dmxeffects.dmx
Class Universe

java.lang.Object
  dmxeffects.dmx.Universe

public class Universe
extends java.lang.Object

Class to store the values within a DMX Universe.

Author:
chris

Method to return the singleton instance of the Universe.

Returns:

destroyInstance

setValue

public void setValue(int channelNumber,
                     int channelValue)
              throws InvalidChannelNumberException,
                     InvalidChannelValueException
Method to set the value of a channel in the Universe to a specific value based upon some input.

Parameters:
channelNumber - The channel number that the value applies to. This ranges from 1 to 512.
channelValue - The value that the channel is set to. This ranges from 0 to 255.
Throws:
InvalidChannelNumberException - Exception for when the channelNumber does not follow the specification.
InvalidChannelValueException - Exception for when the channelValue does not follow the specification.

getValue

public int getValue(int channelNumber)
             throws InvalidChannelNumberException
Method to return a given value

Parameters:
channelNumber - The channel number for which the value should be returned. This ranges from 1 to 512.
Returns:
The value of the channel requested.
Throws:
InvalidChannelNumberException - Exception for when the channelNumber does not follow the specification.

setAssociation

public void setAssociation(int channelNumber,
                           java.lang.String associatedElement)
                    throws InvalidChannelNumberException
Method to insert data to the user indicating what the a channel is associated with. This will include other modules, or perhaps just a light that the user wishes to label.

Parameters:
channelNumber - The number of the channel for which the association exists.
associatedElement - A String naming the element for which the association end.
Throws:
InvalidChannelNumberException - The channelNumber doesn't meet the specification.

Get the name of the element associated with the specified channel number.

Parameters:
channelNumber - The number of the channel for which the association exsists.
Returns:
The String naming the element for which the association exists.
Throws:
invalidChannelNumberExecption - The channelNumber doesn't meet the specification.
InvalidChannelNumberException
